Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took on particular significance after wet weather wreaked havoc the day before
Group 1 is wide open after both matches in Melbourne on Friday -- Australia v England and Afghanistan v Ireland -- were washed out
Others: Sri Lanka made a fast start, with Finn Allen and Devin Conway both departing in the space of three overs to put New Zealand in a heap of pressure and at 2-11
Sri Lanka lost three early wickets and in need of one of their own players standing up like Phillips did
Sri Lanka managed just 24 runs in the power play and immediately gave up another wicket right away
The wickets continued to fall and it did not take long for Sri Lanka to be all out, with New Zealand claiming a comfortable victory
